origination.corpname: University of Michigan. Dept. of Biology.

did.unittitle: Dept. of Biology (University of Michigan) Records 1879-[ongoing]
did.abstract: Department of Biology (established 1986) of the University of Michigan, and of its predecessor unit, the Division of Biological Sciences, and the departments (Botany and Zoology) that comprised the division. Records include minutes, correspondence, course materials, and various subject files.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The record group was donated by the Department of Biology (Donor No. 7328).

accessrestrict.p: The records are open for research with the exception of search files and various personnel and student files. Individual folders (arranged by year) in the Promotions series (boxes 18-20) are closed for thirty years from date of creation. The contents lists contains notations for all other folders which have been closed and removed to box 20 because their contents relate to student/personnel confidential matters.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Board of Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box no., Dept. of Biology (University of Michigan) records, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: The beginnings of the Department of Biology can be traced to 1875, when separate lectures in biology evolved from the Departments of Botany and Zoology. Instruction in botany and zoology at the University of Michigan began in the 1840s, several years after the appointment of the university's first professor of botany and zoology in 1838. Botany and zoology were initially taught by the same professors, but separate departments were established in 1879. In order to promote closer communication between members of the biology faculty and the administration of the University, an informal group called the Division of the Biological Sciences was formed in 1948. The division helped to coordinate research and other activities of related departments, schools, and colleges. In 1975, the Regents authorized the formal creation of the Division of Biological Sciences, as an administrative unit within the College of Literature, Sciences, and the Arts. The new division was responsible for the coordination of curricula and research in the various disciplines of the biological sciences. On July 1, 1986, the Division of Biological Sciences became the Department of Biology.

scopecontent.p: The Department of Biology records, 1879-19992, measure 5 linear feet and include minutes, correspondence, course materials, and various subject files. The records are organized into ten series: Departmental and Divisional Records, Printed Material, Divisional Administration, Staff, Academics, Students, Logistics, Biological Units, Outside Relations, and Promotions.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.corpname: University of Michigan. Dept. of Botany.

University of Michigan. Institute of Human Biology.
University of Michigan. Laboratory of Vertebrate Biology.
controlaccess.subject: Minority college students--Michigan--Ann Arbor.

scopecontent.p: The departmental and divisional records are divided into three subseries: the Division of Biological Sciences, the Botany Department, and the Zoology Department. Material within each of these subseries is arranged alphabetically by topic or committee name and then chronologically. Records of Division of Biological Sciences that existed from 1948 to 1975, and of its successor of the same name, are filed in the same series but can be distinguished by date. The records consist primarily of minutes of faculty and committee meetings, correspondence, reports, newsletters, course outlines, and announcements. Of particular note are the minutes of faculty meetings of the Botany and Zoology Departments, which run from the 1910s to 1975, with some gaps, and the Zoology Department Executive Committee minutes, which date from 1934 to 1975.

In addition to the departmental and divisional records, there are several folders of miscellaneous material relating to the Biological Stations, Botanical Gardens, the Great Lakes Research Institute, the Laboratory of Vertebrate Biology, and the Natural Science Study Committee. These folders are filed at the end of the collection under the heading "Miscellaneous."

did.unittitle: Research, Committee on: "The Present Status of Research" March, 1955
Plan for Botanical Department and Botanical Garden 1912-1913
Review of Department (Report of Visiting Panel) 1966
Institute of Human Biology and Laboratory of Vertebrate

scopecontent.p: The Divisional Administration series (3.2 linear feet) is arranged alphabetically by subject and contains records which relate to the internal activities of the Department of Biology. The records include meeting minutes, committee files, and internal and external review materials. There is also General Correspondence, primarily to and from the chairman. It is in chronological order in box 9; the correspondence in box 20 arrived unfoldered and in no order and has only been foldered.

did.unittitle: College of Literature, Science and the Arts
Committee on Formulation of the Rules of
"An Informational Report for the Committees Reviewing the Herbarium in Fall 1979"

scopecontent.p: The Staff series (2.5 linear feet) is arranged alphabetically by subject. It contains materials on hiring policies and searches for both academic and non-academic positions.

did.unittitle: Committee on Promotions and Staff Development 1974-1976
Literature, Science and the Arts, College of, Dean Candidates, 1975-76
Center for Human Growth and Development (CHGD), Directorship 1979-1980

scopecontent.p: The Academics series (1.5 linear feet) is arranged alphabetically by subject. The series includes records on curriculum and program development.

did.unittitle: Curriculum Committee, Division of Biological Science

scopecontent.p: The Students series (.75 linear feet) is arranged alphabetically by subject and is almost exclusively concerned with graduate students and graduate education. The series includes graduate committee minutes, M.S./M.A. committee minutes, and files on graduate student support.

The Logistics series (1 linear foot) is arranged alphabetically by subject and contains records pertaining to maintenance of buildings and equipment. The records include files on various renovation projects.

The Biological Units series (.75 linear feet) is arranged alphabetically by subject and contains the records of the various units maintained by the department including the Amphibian Center, Biological Station, Botanical Gardens, Herbarium, the Mouse Genetics Center and the Museum of Zoology.

The Outside Relations series (.75 linear feet) is arranged alphabetically by subject and documents the department's relationship to other units in the University of Michigan. The series includes records pertaining to the Great Lakes Research Division and the Institute of Science and Technology, and materials from Chairman Dawson's trip with President Harold Shapiro to China in 1981.

did.unittitle: Center for Human Growth and Development 1978-1979
Institute of Science and Technology (IST Executive Committee)
Relations with Other School/Colleges (primarily University of Michigan)

scopecontent.p: The Promotions series (2.5 linear feet) is comprised of files, arranged chronologically, on promotion decisions. The Promotions files are closed for thirty years from date of creation.
